Moral: don't be one of those college students that are lazy.

topics.body:
"@ToskiHero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5525d6db6368721bd9510a00#post_5525d6db6368721bd9510a00
You're going to be just fine.

The sorts of jobs that are looking at being eliminated are low income jobs like walmart, mcdonalds, janitors or such.


But for the love of god don't dick around thinking that "oh if worse comes to worse I'll just work at mcdonalds" cause the robots that are looking at replacing those jobs only cost at most 10k now; keep in mind that on minimum wage full time you're earning 14k a earn so it's now cheaper to have robots do the work of low income jobs and that they don't have to rest and that you can have them work 24/7/365.

How bad is the low income job long term outlook looking?  Essentially low income jobs are so fucked that the government is now thinking about having programming be a required high school subject so that students have some level of skilled labor knowledge so that they aren't forever stuck in their parent's house.

Tl:dr; don't fuck around with college cause low income unskilled jobs are being eliminated very quickly.

topics.body:
"@ToskiHero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5525d6db6368721bd9510a00#post_5525d6db6368721bd9510a00
Dual major in business, economics, or something technical. You can parlay your passion into something more stable and at a higher income while also writing about things you care about on the side as a consultant. If you hit it big, then you can go independent on your passion. If you bust,  then you still have some training to transition into another field.
